tool_description: Manages comprehensive metadata for knowledge base articles including author information, timestamps, version details, and custom metadata fields for enhanced organization and tracking.

author_department.description: Department of the author: Support, Product, Engineering, or Documentation

expiry_date.description: Date when content should be reviewed for updates

priority_level.description: Content priority level (1-5, where 1 is highest priority)

access_level.description: Access control: Public, Internal, or Restricted

language_code.description: ISO language code for the article content

custom_fields.description: Custom metadata field key-value pairs (format: key:value)

related_products.description: List of products this article relates to

update_frequency.description: How often content should be reviewed: Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly, or Annually

error_messages: Invalid article ID: Article ID must be a non-empty string
Invalid author department: Must be one of Support, Product, Engineering, or Documentation
Invalid priority level: Must be an integer between 1 and 5
Invalid access level: Must be one of Public, Internal, or Restricted
Invalid date format: Dates must be in ISO 8601 format (date-time)
Invalid language code: Must be a valid ISO 639-1 language code
Invalid update frequency: Must be one of Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly, or Annually
Custom fields format error: Custom fields must be in key:value format
Too many custom fields: Maximum of 20 custom fields allowed
usage: Provide article_id, author_name, and author_department. Optionally add last_review_date, expiry_date, priority_level (1-5), access_level, language_code, custom_fields array, related_products, compliance_tags, and update_frequency to enrich article metadata.

metadata_record.description: Complete metadata record for the article

creation_timestamp.description: When the metadata record was created

metadata_version.description: Version number of the metadata record

next_review_date.description: Calculated next review date based on update frequency
